com.wx.servercomm.http

Class BufferedHttpRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wx.servercomm.http.AbstractHttpRequest
      • com.wx.servercomm.http.BufferedHttpRequest

  • public class BufferedHttpRequest
extends AbstractHttpRequest
    Wrapper of an AbstractHttpRequest that will buffer every request in memory for a given time period.

    Note: the buffer always starts of empty.

    Created on 08/10/2015

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • BufferedHttpRequest

        public BufferedHttpRequest(AbstractHttpRequest httpGet,
                           long validityPeriod)
        Initialize a new buffered HTTP Get.

        Each buffered page is considered valid for a given period of time. When an invalid page is requested, the buffered page is dropped and a new request is performed.
        Alternatively, a period of 0 can be set to indicate that the buffered pages should stay permanently.

        Note: When a buffered page ultimately ends its validity period, it actually stays in the buffer (memory) until the next request to the same url. To clear all invalid pages from the buffer, use the clearInvalid() method.

        Parameters:
        httpGet - Underlying AbstractHttpRequest used to perform the actual requests
        validityPeriod - Period (in milliseconds) during which a buffered page is considered valid
